title: Dynamical Dark Energy or Modified Gravity? Signatures in Gravitational Wave Propagation
summary: This study discusses the implications of recent DESI Baryon Acoustic Oscillations (BAO) DR2 and DESyr5 supernovae datasets for modified gravity, employing a model-independent approach to reconstruct dark energy density and estimate perturbation-level quantities.
usefulness_reason: The paper explicitly mentions using "DESI Baryon Acoustic Oscillations (BAO) DR2 and DESyr5 compilation of supernovae (SNe) datasets," which are large-scale astronomical survey datasets. This directly relates to the 'Survey data' aspect of the query.
